body:
The four of you touch down on a cold stone floor in complete darkness. It is cold and musty in the Plath House basement, and so dark that even three flashlights struggle to illuminate the path ahead. Ramona can provide lore, Rachel can provide strength, and Lisa can communicate outside the basement. You can assist in combat and heavy lifting, but you cannot communicate very effectively directly with Rachel.

+ + +

Will you keep the team together, or split up? In this special case, splitting the team can result in controlling another character temporarily. Keeping the party together will remain focused on Chuck.
Did you bring any weapons? If not, someone should go up and grab some heavy tools from the wine cellar.
Stick together, at least you'll still know each other's locations when you get lost.

I fucking love the header image

Keep together until we have a task we need to split for.

>>939120
Keep together
No reason to split. Keep together and move onward.

No amount of heavy lifting can move that beaver's ass. Or can it...

Split up. Grab Lisa.
Also: Ask Lisa if she's boned Geoff yet.

>>939209
Maybe we should be in back, to guard the rear.

From all who might seek to thrust themselves in it.
Split up!

There is no reason to split up right now if all we're doing is going down a straight path.

Lead on, chuck.

The only reason I could see for splitting up (besides memes) is for the opportunity to control another character. As interesting as that could be, now is not the time to do that. We do not have effective ways to communicate between groups or a reliable way to regroup if/when something notable is found.
As for marching order: Front Rachel Lisa Ramona Chuck
Rachel as primary muscle in front, Lisa and Ramona in middle as support, and Chuck in back as emergency rear cover.

>>939530
The person with the best eyesight should go second and hold one of the flashlights so Rachel can keep both hands empty and ready.
I'd go for Rachel, Chuck, Ramona, Lisa as the chance of something getting us from behind for the moment is slim.
Watch Ramona's booty as you walk behind her
Stick together. Chuck takes the lead. Have Rachel in the middle to watch Ramona and Lisa.

You: "I think we should really stick together down here."

Lisa: "Yeah. That's probably…"

Lisa's voice cracks and trembles with fear.

Ramona shines her light down the tunnel, and it lands upon an imposing shape. Your heart skips a beat, triggering your instinct to run. You and the rest stay put after a flinch.

Ramona: "What…"
Ramona: " Is that? "

Um, a still?
Rifle through the drawers.

>>939859
It looks like that old water torture device.
What's it doing down here?
This is where Susanna died the first time.
Check if there's still any of that juicy holy water in that tank.
Explain to the group that they are looking at the device that the demons used to torture the unpure back when they were people. How it got down here though you dont know.
We could make so much murderhooch with this.
It looks like a bellows, a vacuum cleaner, and an insecticide sprayer got together and had a baby.

>>939979
What?

>>940498
I mean that's what that device looks like a strange fusion of those objects. There's definitely a bellows in there, at the very least.

"Oh, back before they got killed the first time, those priests strapped Susanna into this and tried to replace her blood with... holy water, I think? Better not tell her we found it. Also maybe we should take it apart in case they get any bright ideas about doing it to someone again, if we can do it quietly."

it looks like an oxygen tank, or an anesthetic gas, with some older equipment for basement surgery and mad science.

ask ramona if she has any idea of the kind of things that went on down here.
Go through the drawers.
Maybe Lisa could ask the mayor what that thing is?

You inspect the peculiar mechanism. It is a bellows attached to some kind of tank, with tubes protruding from the top. At the end of each tube is a metal cannula. Air and sputters of fluid flow from the cannulas when you pump the bellows, creating a ghastly gurgling noise.

The machine is familiar, but you cannot quite place it.

You: "No idea."

You shine your light around the room, which appears to have no other available light sources. To the right are a bookshelf and a cabinet against the room's brick walls. A few of the support beams appear to be old, sagging, or broken. There is one door on the far side of the room, and a second one to the left. Exits in this are FAR DOOR, LEFT DOOR, and EXIT.

Rachel appears deeply unsettled. The room has a viscerally foreboding aura that menaces you despite being totally silent. Ramona is unmoved, but Lisa is breathing loudly.

Go left door!
I wonder if some of those screams Susanna hears down here are her own.
Examine bookcase.
Check the bookcase, tease lisapanting.

>>940726
You
YOU'VE SEEN THAT INFERNAL CONTRAPTION BEFORE!
In Susanna's memories.

It's used to inject "Holy" water or some other vile substance into its victims.

Susanna was tortured here.
Open cabinet.

>>940731
These are my major proposals, too.
Inspect the cabinet
